lexUnit.name: snore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a snorting or grunting sound in a person's breathing while they are asleep.

sentence.text: Do you wake up regularly to a deafening snore and feel there is no alternative but to give your partner a hefty prod ?
Almost before she had finished speaking , the eyelids had drooped and with a faint snore and a little wriggle , Ann Butler was once more asleep .
If you want to make love you may well feel it discreet to listen for your neighbour 's snores before you start the bed-springs rattl .
At an especially porcine snore he punched Pete 's mattress , taking pleasure in the pain as the wire scraped skin from his knuckles .
She could hear the drone of the television from the sitting-room , the snores of her father-in-law , and her mother 's deliberate silence at the other end of the line .
A snore from the human shook the office .
Athelstan whirled round as a loud snore from Cranston broke the silence .
There was a snore from the other bunk .
While trying to get through the perimeter they were discovered by a German patrol , but in a flash of pure genius , one of the Frenchmen feigned a drunken snore .
All she could hear were soft snores .
In the attic room she lay on the narrow straw mattress listening to Sally 's snores , watching stars brighten in the charcoal sky and struggling to push away the growing sense of responsibility .
Each indrawn breath was a little throaty snore .
They had sawtooth snores , and were dreaming about eating someone .
Herbert Fraser 's snores were another matter : a robust , masculine , uninhibited production .
From the tack room Umberto 's snores rent the air .
Duncan turned and looked at his sleeping companion , now slumped in his seat , his mouth open as his snores rumbled across the cabin .
Elinor , now asleep in the bedroom , her square jaw up like a tombstone , her mouth as wide as a new grave , her light snore ticking fitfully , like some tired machine .
